name: Donecle
description: Donecle is a Toulouse‑based startup specializing in fully automated aircraft inspection using autonomous drone systems. Their drones, equipped with laser positioning technology and high‑resolution imaging, capture external surface data which is analyzed via machine‑learning algorithms to detect defects, with inspectors validating the results
industry: Aerospace / Aircraft maintenance automation (aeronautical construction and spatial services)
size: Approximately 20–49 employees (category: small to medium enterprise) (annuaire-entreprises.data.gouv.fr)

name: Dronetix
description: Dronétix Technologie specializes in developing autonomous inspection robots—including drones and rovers—with onboard artificial intelligence and machine learning-based post-processing software (e.g., photogrammetry, point‑cloud comparison, object detection). It enables fully autonomous inspection missions without a remote pilot
industry: Aerospace / UAV technology – specifically autonomous drone-based inspection and robotics software
size: Estimated “0” employees listed on Gust, indicating a very small startup (possibly pre‑incorporation or early stage)

name: Rizse
industry: Aviation & Aerospace (focusing on drone-based inspection technologies) — specifically related to aircraft inspections, robotics, AI, and aerospace maintenance
size: Approximately 11–50 employees. Crunchbase lists 11–50 employees; Employbl lists 5–20 employees. The broader consensus is in the “11–50” range
location: Headquarters in Austin, Texas, United States. The address is commonly given as 701 Brazos Street, Austin, TX, USA

name: EddyWise
description: Since 2010, EddyWise has been designing and manufacturing advanced systems for eddy current testing, material grade sorting, and non-contact dimension measurement. Their solutions support smart, automated quality control—enabling traceability, defect detection, and integration into production lines across industries such as aerospace, automotive, oil & gas, power generation, and metals
industry: Non‑destructive testing (NDT) technologies and smart manufacturing automation (Eddy Current Testing systems)
size: Not available (no publicly accessible records on employee count were found)
location: Headquarters in İzmir, Turkey (Folkart Towers, Manas Boulevard, İzmir, Türkiye)

name: Applied Technical Services
description: Applied Technical Services, Inc. (“ATS”) provides engineering, testing, inspection, certification, calibration, and forensic consulting services. Since its founding in 1967, it has built a reputation for delivering accurate, reliable results across disciplines such as metallurgy, nondestructive testing, mechanical testing, chemical analysis, and forensic engineering
industry: Engineering/testing/inspection services—specifically in the Testing, Inspection, and Certification (TIC) sector; recognized industry listings include Aerospace & Defense, and Commercial & Industrial Machinery Maintenance
location: Headquarters in Marietta, Georgia, United States
